DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and tolerability of initiating LCZ696 in heart failure patients with reduced ejection fraction (HF-rEF) using conservative (reaching target dose over 6 weeks) and condensed (reaching target dose over 3 weeks) up-titration regimens.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of Initiating LCZ696 in Heart Failure Patients
DOC.criteria: Age ≥ 18 years; CHF with New York Heart Association class IIIV; left ventricular ejection fraction ≤ 35%; on beta blockers Potassium > 5.2 mmol/l; estimated glomerular filtration rate < 30 ml/min/1.73 m2; systolic blood pressure <100 mmHg or > 180 mmHg; history of intolerance to recommended target doses of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.
DOC.keyword: Heart failure, reduced ejection fraction, LCZ696, titration, safety, tolerability
